reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Validation of ASF diagnostic test in Tanzania

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award From December 1-12, 2014, two APHIS subject matter experts from the Foreign Animal Disease Diagnostic Laboratory (FADDL) traveled to Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, and collaborated with the Tanzania Veterinary Laboratory Agency in performance of a validation study on diagnostic methods for African Swine Fever (ASF). APHIS provided all of the necessary equipment, reagents and consumables required for the project. The validation project incorporated the use of samples from naturally infected swine, with the final goal of confirming if the testing method in place was capable of detecting circulating strains of ASF that are found throughout the world at acceptable sensitivity and specificity levels..

participating-org.narrative: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS)
The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Strong partners for over five decades, Tanzania and the United States are working towards a shared vision of improving the quality of life for all Tanzanians. Despite its political stability and high levels of economic growth over the past two decades, roughly 28 percent of the population lives below the poverty line. The goal of U.S. assistance is to promote a healthy, prosperous, democratic, well-governed and secure Tanzania.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Salaries and Expenses, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Agriculture
